title: Opinion on new 2024 rules for bonus action spellcasting

posts.author: RulesMaster
posts.content:
I've been thinking about rules lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about rules that came up in our game last night.

The rules for rules seem a bit ambiguous to me. On page 123 it states one thing, but then on page 145 it seems to contradict that. How do you interpret this?

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about rules?
posts.thread_title: Opinion on new 2024 rules for bonus action spellcasting

posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for rules, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

In our last session, we encountered a Mind Flayer and tried to use rules to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

For my next character, I want to focus on rules as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

posts.author: DMScreener
posts.content:
My DM interprets action differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

When DMing, I like to use action as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of action to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about action. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with action that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use action to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for action are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

Our table uses a house rule for action where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

In my campaign, we had a situation with action that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
